steps.title: Take a CD or CD-R which is defunct or useless and place it in a microwave oven, standing up in the middle against a glass or paper cup.
steps.content: Take a CD or CD-R which is defunct or useless and place it in a microwave oven, standing up in the middle against a glass or paper cup. Do not use metal materials as a holder. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Set the microwave for high on five seconds.
steps.content: Set the microwave for high on five seconds. Close the door completely shut and start cooking.

steps.title: Be prepared to stop the microwave when the CD starts smoking.
steps.content: Be prepared to stop the microwave when the CD starts smoking. These fumes are unhealthy when inhaled. A well-aired room beforehand, such as an open window near the oven, will help eliminate the smoke effectively. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Enjoy the show.
steps.content: Enjoy the show. The heated aluminum of the CD creates a very small electrical storm complete with lightning and sparks. You can observe all this activity through the oven door, though normal precautions have to be taken.

steps.title: Wait for a few seconds before retrieving the CD.
steps.content: Wait for a few seconds before retrieving the CD. Even after just five seconds the disc can be conducting electrical currents. Touching a freshly-destroyed CD with bare hands could burn you. Do not inhale the air outside the oven just after a session. Let the microwave cool and air the room out by opening windows . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Observe the layers of the CD.
steps.content: Observe the layers of the CD. Notice the different patterns and paths etched over the material creating tiny metallic "islands".
